docs.abstract: Fighting in the country has been far more frequent in the east, west and south instead of its capital, Khartoum.
docs.snippet: Fighting in the country has been far more frequent in the east, west and south instead of its capital, Khartoum.
docs.lead_paragraph: In a country long plagued by rebellions, coups and genocidal violence, the scenes of combat taking place in Sudan’s capital are notable because, until now, Sudan’s wars have unfolded on the geographic and political peripheries of the vast African nation.

headline.main: Sudan Is Not Accustomed to Fighting in Its Capital

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity

byline.original: By Isabella Kwai and Declan Walsh

docs.abstract: Taking a cue from Mozart, András Schiff appeared with the New York Philharmonic as both piano soloist and conductor.
docs.snippet: Taking a cue from Mozart, András Schiff appeared with the New York Philharmonic as both piano soloist and conductor.
docs.lead_paragraph: There was a time, during darker days of the pandemic, when orchestral concerts departed from their usual formats — worn-down cookie cutters of a curtain-raiser, concerto and symphony — and turned into something more unpredictable, and open-minded.

headline.main: Review: The Philharmonic’s Artist in Residence Wears Two Hats

docs.abstract: Readers describe the decisions at the end of their pet’s lives. Also: A.I. in the courts; book bans; Africa’s elephants; math and beauty.
docs.snippet: Readers describe the decisions at the end of their pet’s lives. Also: A.I. in the courts; book bans; Africa’s elephants; math and beauty.

headline.main: The Guilt of Putting Down Your Pet

docs.abstract: Thousands of Christians gathered in the Ukrainian capital to mark Holy Week, one year after Ukraine’s army forced Russian troops back from the area around Kyiv.
docs.snippet: Thousands of Christians gathered in the Ukrainian capital to mark Holy Week, one year after Ukraine’s army forced Russian troops back from the area around Kyiv.
docs.lead_paragraph: Hundreds of Orthodox Christians lined up outside a cathedral in the Ukrainian capital, Kyiv, after a service on Sunday as they waited for a priest to bless them with a spray of water as part of an Easter tradition.

headline.main: Under the Shadow of War, Kyiv Celebrates Orthodox Easter

byline.original: By Brendan Hoffman and Matthew Mpoke Bigg

docs.abstract: Known for his iron resolve and his attention to detail, he transformed Grey Advertising from a midsize agency into a multinational powerhouse.
docs.snippet: Known for his iron resolve and his attention to detail, he transformed Grey Advertising from a midsize agency into a multinational powerhouse.
docs.lead_paragraph: Edward H. Meyer, an empire-building chief executive who, using an iron-willed management style and a laser focus on even the smallest details, transformed a midsize New York advertising agency into the global power known as Grey Group, died on Tuesday at his apartment in Manhattan. He was 96.

headline.main: Edward H. Meyer, Who Built an Advertising Empire, Dies at 96

docs.abstract: The victim was a former politician, a notorious criminal and a Muslim. Afterward, two government officials described the killing as akin to divine justice.
docs.snippet: The victim was a former politician, a notorious criminal and a Muslim. Afterward, two government officials described the killing as akin to divine justice.
docs.lead_paragraph: When the police in India’s largest state put a notorious mobster-politician’s associates in their sights, they unleashed a take-no-prisoners campaign that at times mirrored the brutality of their underworld targets, who had been implicated in a brazen murder.

headline.main: Killing on Live TV Renews Alarm About India’s Slide Toward Extrajudicial Violence

byline.original: By Mujib Mashal, Hari Kumar and Sameer Yasir

docs.abstract: Easy but substantial: bricklayer-style nachos with puntas al albañil, and one-pot tortellini with meat sauce.
docs.snippet: Easy but substantial: bricklayer-style nachos with puntas al albañil, and one-pot tortellini with meat sauce.
docs.lead_paragraph: Good morning. A while back, Kay Chun developed a great recipe for manicotti (above) designed for weeknight cooking. But for a Sunday supper, I skip the store-bought marinara and instead make Marcella Hazan’s Bolognese sauce to drench the stuffed pasta. It’s more work to do that, to be sure, but it’s work I enjoy — labor exchanged for smiles and conversation with friends and family.

docs.abstract: Multiple people were also injured in the shooting on Saturday night in Dadeville, Ala., the authorities said.
docs.snippet: Multiple people were also injured in the shooting on Saturday night in Dadeville, Ala., the authorities said.
docs.lead_paragraph: At least four people were killed and several others were injured in a shooting at a birthday party on Saturday night in an Alabama city, officials said.

headline.main: Alabama Birthday Party Shooting Leaves at Least 4 Dead

docs.abstract: In the pantheon of yokai, spooky beings of Japanese folklore embody anxieties ancient and modern. On Shodoshima, an art contest helps bring new ones to life.
docs.snippet: In the pantheon of yokai, spooky beings of Japanese folklore embody anxieties ancient and modern. On Shodoshima, an art contest helps bring new ones to life.
docs.lead_paragraph: Most Japanese schoolchildren know the kappa as a trickster who looks like a cross between a frog and a turtle with an indented head. If you’re not careful, it could drag you into the river to drown. The tengu, identifiable by its bright red face and long nose, lurks in the woods. Beware of the tanuki, a supernatural variation of a raccoon dog, for it may make a fool of you when it crosses your path.

headline.main: A Japanese Island Where the Wild Things Are

byline.original: By Motoko Rich and Hikari Hida

docs.abstract: A lumber fleet left the docks of Baraga, Mich., in 1914, and was never seen again. A team of shipwreck hunters found two of its vessels nearly 100 years later.
docs.snippet: A lumber fleet left the docks of Baraga, Mich., in 1914, and was never seen again. A team of shipwreck hunters found two of its vessels nearly 100 years later.
docs.lead_paragraph: For more than 30 years, researchers have scoured the depths of Lake Superior for vessels lost to time. Each carries a dramatic story of lives at risk and, many times, lives lost. A stretch of shoreline in Michigan with about 200 known shipwrecks is called “Graveyard of the Great Lakes.”

headline.main: A Century-Old Mystery Surfaces From Lake Superior
